text: I'm so excited to be showing this new
take on a pie today it's called a
pinwheel pie it has a really beautiful
top that creates kind of a spinner
effect today I'm doing a cherry pie with
my favorite sour cherries they created
the best cherry pie because they have
that great tartness to them so to get
started one cup of sugar in a bowl three
tablespoons of cornstarch and this is
the thickness of course with cherries
they're gonna give off juices so you
need a good thick nor like cornstarch
eighth of a teaspoon of cinnamon this is
just a little flavoring for the cherries
and then of course salt which brings out
all the flavors to this vanilla bean I
use vanilla beans all the time so just a
small paring knife split the beam down
the middle now that it's split use the
end of the blade and just scrape out the
seeds there are millions of tiny little
vanilla seeds in here and you want every
last one of them those go in here
vanilla and cherry are so good together
it's like a match made in heaven now I'm
just gonna use my fingers because that's
the best way to incorporate the vanilla
bean seeds into the sugar and cornstarch
mixture that looks great
so now I'm gonna add my sour cherries I
have one in 3/4 pounds frozen sour
cherries but I could also use two pounds
of fresh I'm gonna add all the juices
everything these are slightly thawed I'm
getting a big spoon mix all this
together this color is incredible so now
I have my pie shell already rolled out
I've lined a 9 inch pie plate with it
and just kept a little bit of an edge
around the outside so ingo the cherries
everything will thicken up in the oven
thanks to that cornstarch get it all in
there even it out and we have 2
tablespoons of butter cut into small
pieces just kind of dot these around the
top so now we got to create the pinwheel
top this is the other half of the pie
dough
I'm gonna roll it out about 1/8 of an
inch thick
definitely dust my board with flour and
dust the top of the dough as well I like
to keep turning the dough as I'm rolling
it so that I'll keep the nice round
shape and this is gonna get cut into
half inch strips and that is what we're
gonna use to make our pinwheel looks
good and feels good so now I have my
ruler and a piece of cutter these are
the best tools for cutting nice even
strips I'm just gonna take this ragged
edge off I'm ball the half inch strips
just cut them all you're not gonna
believe how these strips turn into a
beautiful pinwheel time for twisting and
to move this pie closer so they can put
my strips right on top so take a strip
and then gently twist it into the center
and just spiral it around then next
strip put it on to this one just kind of
attach it to the one that's there pinch
it together and you can see it's gonna
act just like a lattice because there's
parts that is covered with the dough and
parts that are uncovered the last strip
that looks great
all our strips are on they look so
pretty so now some egg wash over the
tops I have one egg give this a beat
just to combine it some brush the whole
pie all of the dough with this egg wash
which will really give the pie to a
beautiful golden color and make sure to
brush the very edge with the egg wash as
well you want everything to be golden
beautiful so this is ready for the oven
375 degrees it will take about an hour
and a half you want everything to be
golden and all the juices to be bubbling
and the bottom nice and brown then you
know it's done here is our beautiful pie
we've cooled it on a wire rack and it's
still a little bit warm but it's time to
glaze it I've warmed up a half a cup of
apricot jam and I'm going to pass it
through a strainer just to take out any
of the larger pieces
and also warming it loosens it up so be
easy to brush on to the pie you could
use any kind of jam but I like apricot
because it gives a nice neutral flavor
and the colors not too dark so it'll
just kind of blend in with the crust
this goes on to the crust itself and
that's the part that you want to glaze
it's just to shine up these beautiful
pastry strips it's nice to get a little
bit of that fresh Tang too when you bite
into it it really just makes the pastry
become even more golden okay that is a
beauty look at that it's so pretty
I can't believe it and now let's cut
into it and see those cherries it's
almost a shame to cut into it it's so
nice the crust bakes a little bit on the
edge so I'm just gonna loosen it loosen
the bottom onto the plate wow that is
one good-looking piece of pie so I'm
gonna give it a try you can see the
little vanilla bean specks in here oh my
god so good maybe a little vanilla ice
cream on top next time
you
